properties.areaDesc: Northern Marinette County; Florence; Northern Oconto County; Southern Marinette County
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 12 at 7:00PM CST by NWS Green Bay WI
properties.description:
The arctic cold front was moving south across Marinette and Oconto
Counties this evening. Light snow will taper off to scattered
flurries by mid to late evening. Any additional snowfall
accumulation should be around an inch or less. The combination
of the falling snow, along with melting snow on pavement surfaces
and falling air temperatures well below freezing could lead to a
flash freeze this evening. Gusty northerly winds may also create
some areas of blowing and drifting snow.

Overnight, temperatures are expected to fall to 5 below to 5 above
zero. The combination of the cold temperatures and gusty northerly
winds will produce wind chill readings in the 10 below to 20
below zero range late tonight into Thursday morning. Wind chill
readings this low can produce frost bite in 30 minutes.

Allow extra travel time if you will be driving this evening as
roads will be slippery due to ice or snow. If venturing outdoors
overnight, wear layers of clothing along with a hat and gloves to
protect yourself from the cold.

NWSheadline: HAZARDOUS TRAVEL CONDITIONS EXPECTED THIS EVENING FOLLOWED BY COLD WIND CHILLS OVERNIGHT
